    • Method Detail

      • startWebServer

        public static org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server startWebServer(int port)
                                                      throws Exception
        Creates and starts embedded web server that is running on given port. Each response has a body that indicates how many bytes were received with a message like "Received x bytes\n".
        Parameters:
        port - The port
        Returns:
        Instance of Server
        Throws:
        Exception - if failed to start

      • startWebServer

        public static org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server startWebServer(int port,
                                             Integer sslPort)
                                                      throws Exception
        Creates and starts embedded web server that is running on given port, including an SSL connector on the other given port. Each response has a body that indicates how many bytes were received with a message like "Received x bytes\n".
        Parameters:
        port - The port
        sslPort - (optional) The ssl port
        Returns:
        Instance of Server
        Throws:
        Exception - if failed to start

      • createProxiedHttpClient

        public static org.apache.http.client.HttpClient createProxiedHttpClient(int port)
                                                                 throws Exception
        Creates instance HttpClient that is configured to use proxy server. The proxy server should run on 127.0.0.1 and given port
        Parameters:
        port - the proxy port
        Returns:
        instance of HttpClient
        Throws:
        Exception

      • createProxiedHttpClient

        public static org.apache.http.client.HttpClient createProxiedHttpClient(int port,
                                                        boolean supportSSL)
                                                                 throws Exception
        Creates instance HttpClient that is configured to use proxy server. The proxy server should run on 127.0.0.1 and given port
        Parameters:
        port - the proxy port
        supportSSL - if true, client will support SSL connections to servers using self-signed certificates
        Returns:
        instance of HttpClient
        Throws:
        Exception
